description:
Great concept but missing huge feature that will cause data lost. 

You will lose data switching between notes instead of autosaving after every change. When there isn't a title it should just use the first words from the first line as a title or just note 1, 2, ... if empty.

just where the bleed does the .txt file store??? This is idiotic programming.
My lovely txt editor corrupted in Fedora and I went to replace it, don't want cloud or other bells and meat whistles and thought this might be good...NOPE. Cannot name files, just dated & no idea where these note files save to email/share, or just see the file in a folder, not within the software...

Re Saving --

(i) A save toobar icon is prominently placed -- Also if you create a new note you are prompted to save your existing note first ... 

(ii) no idea (yet) where text files are -- that location and an export function would be nice (essential?)

Re Organization -- 
(i) Brilliant IOS subheading hack: the first line of your note automatically populates the title (time stamp) as a subheading 

(ii) some might prefer an alphabetic sorting option but for a simple log (e.g., writing project) this approach is perfect ... There is also a note search function but havent played with it.
summary: very nice for dedicated writing project padfile ..

description:
Great simple tabbed notepad.

Feature request:
Option to autosave notes without confirmation.

I love simple and easy to use software and this matches perfectly. 
No hassle but just writing down, what you think.

I would love to be able to use markdown though ;)

Thank you for developing this neat piece of software
Good software, simple and direct to the main function.
